segments.text: I see the woman absorbed in her task by the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet's on, but the water's not draining—it's flooding out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A steady stream pours over the basin edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot's wet already; she must feel something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: No, her face is blank, totally unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes piled up beside her, safe for now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Over there, the boy's on the stool, arm in the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's legs are spreading—oh no, it's tipping.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He holds a plate too; clumsy but determined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl reaches up, eyes on the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're so innocent in their mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But if he falls, it'll be heartbreaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden view outside is beautiful, calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This contrast makes the inside hazards feel worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't look away; it's tense.
segments.speaker: PAR
